question: Formal exams are used to assess students at the end of each semester in many countries. Why are these exams used by schools and universities? What other types of assessment are possible? Give reasons for your answer along with example?
text: In the world of learning, exams are considered to be beneficial to the child and the entire education system.

It is believed that the traditional form of exams is the most accurate way to assess students. Other assessments like projects and coursework are also needed. This essay will discuss  both types of assessment in the ensuing paragraphs.

To commence, there are diverse benefits of conducting  formal tests, one of the prime ones is the ability it has to make the student, tutor and parents in understanding the knowledge and memory. To elaborate, since the tutee will have to revise and reunderstand the concepts for their final exams, it shall automatically become a part of their lifetime memory. Moreover, this pattern of assessment trains the students to handle anxiety and stress, which will indeed be helpful for their future. In order to compete with the competition world.

However, although formal examinations make the child ready for the world, they also can make them have an emotional breakdown and lose confidence. It has been proven by various countries that nearly 20% of the students suffer from permanent mental issues because of  overburden and stress. On the contrary, continual assessments have been suggested to boost confidence, since they assist to promote creativity; vision; along with offering a chance to display skills: Presentation, Communication, Research and Innovation.

Additionally, projects and courses provide a platform to make the learner understand their own potential, so that they can make improvements needed for their learning. Apart from this, based on many surveys, it has been found that pupils find such a pattern to be a more fun way of learning, as they learn the application of theories, which prepares them for their careers.
To reiterate, even though formal examinations help to judge a student's calibre, continual assessments equally help them in making improvements.
